instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with grafik problems
threads.message:
hi, i am just working on that board.

I have picture
running ASD and select Video Controller internal i get in the first(open GL point test) a Failed

if i run the same test now for video controler external this open gl ... test is passed
after that again running only for internal and it passes through without problems

<CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> is replaced already

if i plug in an external monitor there i have no picture

sometimes asd running it shows only  the test for external controler

is it a good idea to reball the gmux?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with grafik problems
threads.message: just spend ages picking of the edge bonding and ensure theres none under the chip, then a reflow will do the trick, Much easier than reballing.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with grafik problems
threads.message:
I tryed that without an result. So i was going to pull the GMUX and put it back recalled.

still not better. So the only thing what could be is an damaged gmux  all power and clocks are ok. 

I replaced now the gmux with a good one from a donor board and voila it works perfect.

thanks for help
